summary:
PROFILE
With experiences in 1) semiconductor manufacturing (process engineer metal deposition), 2) solution design for advanced process control (functional architect of AEC/APC systems at NXP Nijmegen), and 3) smart manufacturing (principal engineer for data analysis and capacity modeling), I have built a solid expertise of support functions in one of the most complex industries: Semiconductor Manufacturing.

MY GOAL?
Get the full potential of Industry 4.0 by developing projects in the field of data collection and big data analysis to develop smart solutions to optimize the overall fab output (both throughput and quality).

SPECIALTIES:
Industrial engineering: Lean Manufacturing, Scheduling and Dispatching, Tool Speed, Efficiency Improvement, Optimization, OEE (Operational Equipment Efficiency), Cycle Time, Factory Automation, Statistical Process Control, Big Data Analysis, Problem Solving, Functional Architect, FICS (Factory Information and Control Systems)

SKILLS
•	Organized and self-motivated self-starter with creative abilities in management and problem solving skills
•	Coordinator within a research group
•	Team player with personality, positive attitude, and a strong sense of duty
•	Ability to relate to people and good reflective listener
•	Practical and experimental skills in computer simulations, electronics and mechanical engineering
•	Make explanatory visualizations of complex problems in layman’s terms
•	Excellent oral and written communication skills: presentations and clarifications for worldwide customers, research papers published and presented at national and international conferences

projects.title: Spin-off projects from INTEGRATE
projects.description:
▪ Implement smart IT-solutions to raise fab throughput. In my role as principal industrial engineer I have coordinated the various activities to implement these new solutions (design, write specifications, testing, debugging, roll-out into fab) 
▪ Loading Trigger application – implement and deploy a GUI-screen to inform operator which tool needs to be (un)loaded urgently. In the lithography department the ‘operational efficiency’ has been increased enormously (idle time reduction ∆ = -6.5%, hiccup reduction ∆ = -1.5%). 
▪ Smart solution to optimize reticle jobs (= reduce time-consumption blade movement). This traveling salesman problem is tackled with an ‘integer linear programming’ solver. It has been implemented in the IT-architecture and resulted in an overall capacity gain on the lithography steppers by ∆ = +1.2%.
ACHIEVEMENT: capacity gain of > 8% for lithography processing (i.e. bottleneck of fab)

projects.title: ENIAC INTEGRATE
projects.description:
Leader WP2 – Equipment Usage Optimization (= development of tools and visual aids which can help to understand and optimize the time consumption of semiconductor process tools)
▪ INTEGRATE aims to develop ‘smart solutions’ to maximize the fab throughput of European semiconductor fabs. This daunting task is characterized by various complicating factors – legacy equipment, compatibility with existing IT-solutions, high-mix (product diversity) and low volumes (many customers).
▪ Responsible for reporting at EU- and NL-level.
▪ Organizer of monthly telecons as well as face-to-face meetings (twice a year) where the collaborators shared their ideas, solution strategies, algorithms and lessons-learned which helped to lower the threshold for ‘copy-paste’ actions to implement smart solutions.
▪ ACHIEVEMENT: world-wide acknowledgement that the wait-time-waste approach can also be applied to legacy equipment, allowing for ‘smart solutions’ in the existing legacy 200mm fabs

projects.title: Implementation of AEC/APC solution at NXP-Semiconductors Nijmegen
projects.description:
▪ Functional architect of APC-solution: design, implementation, testing and deployment.
▪ Initiator of an ICN8-wide program to store process data for analysis and tool-control (called TEMPTATION “Tune Equipment & Match Processes To Analyse Tool data Imported Over Network”).
▪ Intensive collaboration with IT-department at NXP to specify and build and internal APC/APC system (Advanced Equipment/Process Control).
▪ Responsible for business case(s) for continued progress in this program (maintenance and development is currently performed in collaboration with an external IT company - www.avisi.nl).  Process control application rolled out to other external companies (Nexperia).
▪ Performed all pilot analysis to test and implement the system, with many successes in my other roles - 1. improved tungsten processing (process engineer), 2. incident prevention (line yield coordinator), 3. analysis of takt times allowing the identification of operational losses (industrial engineer).

profile_positions.description:
▪ Initiator for analytical research:  started modeling of capacity performance of ICN8 fab by investigating timing information collected in AEC/APC system
▪ In the pilot study for the metal deposition equipment (installed base = 20 AMAT ENDURA) a hidden capacity loss of >7% was identified and recovered in collaboration with the equipment engineers.
▪ Implementation of OEE metric (Overall Equipment Efficiency) in high-mix ICN8 fab, with accurate indicators of rate efficiency losses
▪ The performance analysis of lithography processing (installed base = 35 ASML systems) identified an efficiency loss of >10%.  The ideas for analysis and possible solutions were used in the research proposal for the European collaborative project INTEGRATE (https://cordis.europa.eu/project/rcn/201967/factsheet/en).
